descr.p: IniFiles provides support for handling .ini files. It contains an implementation completely independent of the Windows API for handling such files. The basic (abstract) functionality is defined in and is implemented in and . The API presented by these components is Delphi compatible.

element.name: TCustomIniFile
element.short: Abstract ini file object

descr.p: TCustomIniFile implements all calls for manipulating a .ini. It does not implement any of this behaviour, the behaviour must be implemented in a descendent class like or .
Since TCustomIniFile is an abstract class, it should never be created directly. Instead, one of the TIniFile or TMemIniFile classes should be created.

element.name: TCustomIniFile.Create
element.short: Instantiate a new instance of TCustomIniFile.

descr.p: Create creates a new instance of TCustomIniFile and loads it with the data from AFileName, if this file exists. If the ifoEscapeLineFeeds option is present in AOptions or AEscapeLineFeeds parameter is True, then lines which have their end-of-line markers escaped with a backslash, will be concatenated. This means that the following 2 lines
descr.pre: Description=This is a \ line with a long text
descr.p: is equivalent to
descr.pre: Description=This is a line with a long text
descr.p: By default, not escaping of linefeeds is performed (for Delphi compatibility)
Default options for the property can be specified in AOptions.
A Default string encoding can be specified in aEncoding. If aOwnsEncoding is True the encoding will be freed when the ini file instance is destroyed.

element.errors: If the file cannot be read, an exception may be raised.

element.name: TCustomIniFile.UpdateFile
element.short: Update the file on disk
element.descr: UpdateFile writes the in-memory image of the ini-file to disk. To speed up operation of the inifile class, the whole ini-file is read into memory when the class is created, and all operations are performed in-memory. If CacheUpdates is set to True, any changes to the inifile are only in memory, until they are committed to disk with a call to UpdateFile. If CacheUpdates is set to False, then all operations which cause a change in the .ini file will immediately be committed to disk with a call to UpdateFile. Since the whole file is written to disk, this may have serious impact on performance.

descr.p: TIniFile is an implementation of which does the same as , namely it reads the whole file into memory. Unlike TMemIniFile it does not cache updates in memory, but immediately writes any changes to disk.
TIniFile introduces no new methods, it just implements the abstract methods introduced in TCustomIniFile

descr.p: Create creates a new instance of TIniFile and initializes the class by reading the file from disk if the filename AFileName is specified, or from stream in case AStream is specified. It also sets most variables to their initial values, i.e. AEscapeLineFeeds is saved prior to reading the file, and Cacheupdates is set to False.
Default options for the property can be specified in AOptions.

element.name: TIniFile.DeleteKey
element.short: Delete key
element.descr: DeleteKey deletes the Ident from the section Section. This operation is performed on the in-memory copy of the ini file. if CacheUpdates is False, then the file is immediately updated on disk.

element.name: TIniFile.DeleteKey.Section
element.short: Section in which to delete key

element.name: TIniFile.DeleteKey.Ident
element.short: Name of key to delete

element.name: TIniFile.UpdateFile
element.short: Update the file on disk
element.descr: UpdateFile writes the in-memory data for the ini file to disk. The whole file is written. If the ini file was instantiated from a stream, then the stream is updated. Note that the stream must be seekable for this to work correctly. The ini file is marked as 'clean' after a call to UpdateFile (i.e. not in need of writing to disk).
element.errors: If an error occurs when writing to stream or disk, an exception may be raised.

element.name: TIniFile.Stream
element.short: Stream from which ini file was read
element.descr: Stream is the stream which was used to create the IniFile. The UpdateFile method will use this stream to write changes to.

element.name: TIniFile.CacheUpdates
element.short: Should changes be kept in memory
element.descr: CacheUpdates determines how to deal with changes to the ini-file data: if set to True then changes are kept in memory till the file is written to disk with a call to UpdateFile. If it is set to False then each call that changes the data of the ini-file will result in a call to UpdateFile. This is the default behaviour, but it may adversely affect performance.

element.name: TMemIniFile
element.short: Inifile cached in memory
element.descr: TMemIniFile is a simple descendent of which introduces some extra methods to be compatible to the Delphi implementation of TMemIniFile. The FPC implementation of TIniFile is implemented as a TMemIniFile, except that TIniFile does not cache its updates, and TMemIniFile does.

element.name: TMemIniFile.Create
element.short: Create a new instance of TMemIniFile
element.descr: Create simply calls the inherited Create, and sets the CacheUpdates to True so updates will be kept in memory till they are explicitly written to disk.

element.name: TMemIniFile.Create.AFileName
element.short: Name of file to read data from

element.name: TMemIniFile.Create.AEscapeLineFeeds
element.short: Should linefeed escaping be turned on

element.name: TMemIniFile.Clear
element.short: Clear the data
element.descr: Clear removes all sections and key/value pairs from memory. If CacheUpdates is set to False then the file on disk will immediately be emptied.

element.name: TMemIniFile.GetStrings
element.short: Get contents of ini file as stringlist

descr.p: GetStrings returns the whole contents of the ini file in a single stringlist, List. This includes comments and empty sections.
The GetStrings call can be used to get data for a call to SetStrings, which can be used to copy data between 2 in-memory ini files.

element.name: TMemIniFile.GetStrings.List
element.short: Stringlist in which to copy the data

element.name: TMemIniFile.Rename
element.short: Rename the ini file
element.descr: Rename will rename the ini file with the new name AFileName. If Reload is True then the in-memory contents will be cleared and replaced with the contents found in AFileName, if it exists. If Reload is False, the next call to UpdateFile will replace the contents of AFileName with the in-memory data.

element.name: TMemIniFile.Rename.AFileName
element.short: New filename

element.name: TMemIniFile.Rename.Reload
element.short: Load memory data from new file ?

element.name: TMemIniFile.SetStrings
element.short: Set data from a stringlist

descr.p: SetStrings sets the in-memory data from the List stringlist. The data is first cleared.
The SetStrings call can be used to set the data of the ini file to a list of strings obtained with GetStrings. The two calls combined can be used to copy data between 2 in-memory ini files.

element.name: TMemIniFile.SetStrings.List
element.short: Stringlist to get data from

element.name: THashedStringList
element.short: String list with support for has values
element.descr: THashedStringList is a TStringList descendent which creates has values for the strings and names (in the case of a name-value pair) stored in it. The IndexOf and IndexOfName functions make use of these hash values to quickly locate a value.

element.name: THashedStringList.Create
element.short: Instantiates a new instance of THashedStringList
element.descr: Create calls the inherited Create, and then instantiates the hash tables.
element.errors: If no enough memory is available, an exception may be raised.

element.name: THashedStringList.Destroy
element.short: Clean up instance
element.descr: Destroy cleans up the hash tables and then calls the inherited Destroy.

element.name: THashedStringList.IndexOf
element.short: Returns the index of a string in the list of strings
element.descr: IndexOf overrides the method and uses the hash values to look for the location of S.

element.name: THashedStringList.IndexOf.Result
element.short: Index of S or -1 if S is not in the list.

element.name: THashedStringList.IndexOf.S
element.short: String to locate in the list

element.name: THashedStringList.IndexOfName
element.short: Return the index of a name in the list of name=value pairs
element.descr: IndexOfName overrides the method and uses the hash values of the names to look for the location of Name.

element.name: THashedStringList.IndexOfName.Result
element.short: Index of name Name or -1 if no name=value pair exists with Name.

element.name: THashedStringList.IndexOfName.Name
element.short: Name to look for

element.name: TIniFileSection.Empty.Result
element.short: True if the section is empty

element.name: TCustomIniFile.StripQuotes
element.short: Should quotes be stripped from string values
element.descr: StripQuotes determines whether quotes around string values are stripped from the value when reading the values from file. By default, quotes are not stripped (this is Delphi and Windows compatible).

element.name: TCustomIniFile.ReadInt64
element.short: Read Int64 value

descr.p: ReadInt64 reads a signed 64-bit integer value from the ini file. The value is searched in the Section section, with key Ident.
If the value is not found at the specified Section, Ident pair, or the value is not a Int64 value then the Default value is returned instead.
This function is needed because only reads at most a 32-bit value.

element.name: TCustomIniFile.ReadInt64.Result
element.short: The value found at the specified location, or the default value.

element.name: TCustomIniFile.ReadInt64.Section
element.short: Section to search the value in.

element.name: TCustomIniFile.ReadInt64.Ident
element.short: Key for the value in the specified section

element.name: TCustomIniFile.ReadInt64.Default
element.short: Default value if no valid value was found

element.name: TCustomIniFile.WriteInt64
element.short: Write a Int64 value.
element.descr: WriteInt64 writes Value as a signed 64-bit integer value to section Section, key Ident.

element.name: TCustomIniFile.WriteInt64.Section
element.short: Section to write to

element.name: TCustomIniFile.WriteInt64.Ident
element.short: Key name

element.name: TCustomIniFile.WriteInt64.Value
element.short: Value to write

element.name: TStringHash
element.short: String hash list
element.descr: TStringHash is a Delphi compatibility object. It is not used in the TIniFile implementation. It implements a bucket list for Name=Value pairs, where Value is an integer. This enables quick lookup of values based on a name.

element.name: TStringHash.Create
element.short: Create a new instance of TStringHash
element.descr: Create instantiates a new instance of TStringHash. The ACapacity argument is present for Delphi compatibility, but is otherwise unused.

element.name: TStringHash.Create.ACapacity
element.short: Unused

element.name: TStringHash.Destroy
element.short: Free TStringHash instance
element.descr: Destroy clears the internal data structures and removes the TStringHash instance from memory.

element.name: TStringHash.Add
element.short: Add a new value to the hash
element.descr: Add adds the value Value with name AKey to the list. The behaviour of Add depends on AddReplacesExisting. If if it is False, then the existing value is left unchanged, and an exception is raised. If AddReplacesExisting is True then an existing value is replaced.
element.errors: An exception will be raised if the value already exists and AddReplacesExisting is False

element.name: TStringHash.Add.Key
element.short: Key for this value

element.name: TStringHash.Add.Value
element.short: Value to add to hash

element.name: TStringHash.Clear
element.short: Remove all values
element.descr: Clear removes all values from the hash.

element.name: TStringHash.Modify
element.short: Try to modify an existing value
element.descr: Modify will replace the value of Key with Value. Key must exist. It returns True if the operation was successful. If the value didn't exist, False is returned.

element.name: TStringHash.Modify.Result
element.short: True if the operation was successful

element.name: TStringHash.Modify.Key
element.short: Key to replace

element.name: TStringHash.Modify.Value
element.short: New value for key

element.name: TStringHash.Remove
element.short: Remove a key from the hash
element.descr: Remove removes the key Key from the hash, if it was present.

element.name: TStringHash.Remove.Key
element.short: Key to remove from the hash

element.name: TStringHash.ValueOf
element.short: Retrieve value of Key

descr.p: ValueOf returns the value of AKey, if it is present. if the key is not present, -1 is returned.

element.name: TStringHash.ValueOf.Result
element.short: Value associated with Key

element.name: TStringHash.ValueOf.Key
element.short: Key whose value must be returned.

element.name: TStringHash.AddReplacesExisting
element.short: Should Add replace existing values or not
element.descr: AddReplacesExisting indicates whether will replace an existing value (True) or will raise an exception when an existing value is added (False).
